website_summaries.verdict: Fantastic purchase if you are wanting an extra-capacity collapsible water bottle with a wide mouth lid.
pros: Wide mouth cap makes cleaning a breeze
Able to stand upright when filled with water
Extra-large design holds 48 ounces of water
cons: Some buyers had issues with the product leaking upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: Used as urine vessel while camping in below freezing temperatures on Kilimanjaro.
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, climbing out of a warm sleeping bag and the shelter of a tent to relieve one's self is not the highlight of camping in below freezing temperatures. I mean it takes times to climb in and out, especially if you use a liner. Moreover, it takes time to regenerate that lost heat. For me, 48 oz is about the right size for nighttime evolutions while on Diamox. Any less, and you may have an issue. Being lightweight and collapsable​ really helps with conserving packing space/weight restrictions. Highly recommended for this use.
customer_reviews.author: Nyquesty

customer_reviews.title: The best "Pee Bottle" out there?
customer_reviews.text: I just completed an 8 day climb of Kilimanjaro and one of my concerns going into the trip was having to get up at night in frigid temps to drain my bladder. My father and I both bought one of these bottles and we both agree it was one of the best purchases we made for the trip. The large capacity, wide mouth, tight seal, and ability to be packed flat made it excellent for use as a pee bottle. Spending $20 for something to pee in seems a bit ridiculous but considering the alternative it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional Use
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be gross for some of you but it is what it is. My fella is an outdoorsmen and we go kayaking a lot. I bought this for him thinking it was for his drinking water but on the contrary, he had it on his wishlist for the after effects of drinking water. That's right. Its a pee bottle for when we are on river trips with no viable location to get out. I cracked up when he told me what he really needed it for. But guess what? It works and it hasn't torn his pecker off. There you go fellas.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good so far but plastic is very stiff.
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a standard nalgene cap to fit accessories and be familiar. It's held up for a couple hikes so far. While I've had zero actual issues with it, the plastic is very stiff and crunches up and 'creases' easily compared to similar bladder-bottle products. I can't see this type of plastic lasting too long with frequent use. Maybe I'm wrong? Who knows. I just have a hard time trusting it based on the stiffness and expect it to crack eventually. I'll keep on using it for storing water at base camp but I've decided not to hike distances with it full in a pack.
customer_reviews.author: HotBeverages

customer_reviews.title: Put it through rigorous testing before the return window closes. After 2 months, mine leaks.
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I bought lasted for two years. This one, however, started leaking around the seal where it attaches to the screw-top only 2 months after I bought it. Of course it's passed the return window now so I'm stuck. To say I'm disappointed is putting it mildly.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Just what I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Use it for a tent camping urine bottle. Saves me from having to climb out of my tent in the middle of the night. Big enough to last all night. Works great and packs up small with my camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: swhitting

customer_reviews.title: Lid broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: I've loved Nalgene products for years. When I saw a friend's collapsible bottle (her's a Platypus), I thought Nalgene's version would be even better. It is bigger (48oz compared to their 32oz), but the blue plastic lid broke during my first hiking trip. I've had an identical lid on my regular Nalgene bottle that I got in 2002 and it is still in perfect working order. Either their quality control has gone down the toilet, or I received a defective cap. Either way, I'm not happy. The plastic of the cantene held up in my backpack. It will still be functional, but can no longer easily be carried.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fill our niche.
customer_reviews.text: We quit using this because it isn't very stable when standing. We wanted to use it in our RV, but it turned over on us and made a mess so it now stays in the basement. Seems to be holding up well down there, best I can tell. Probably works fine for backpacking or something.
customer_reviews.author: gizmo

customer_reviews.title: A male campers best friend!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect whiz canteen for the male camper. Wide mouth, excellent capacity, no leaks. Has saved me the inconvenience of stumbling out into the dark on many a night. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a wide mouth, collapsible pee bottle for backpacking. Make sure you mark it for this purpose. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: North Country Reader

customer_reviews.title: Packs up small, stands taller than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.text: The 48 oz stands up at least 12 inches high when full. I would also be concerned about anything slightly sharp poking a hole in it. I bought this for a specific purpose when camping which I think it will do well for. I do not know that I would pack it in my backpack and carry it around full of water. I would be afraid of a hole soaking all my gear/clothes.
customer_reviews.author: David PAmazonTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extra water storage
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these to be able to carry extra water on an exceptionally dry hike. These have proven to be far more durable than I had expected. The beauty of these is the minimal weight and space they take up in your pack. I keep at least one in my pack even when I don't need to carry more than my normal 2 nalgene's, figure if circumstances change and I need to add some reserve water along the trail the couple of extra ounces I have carried will have paid off. They are a bit awkward when filled as they will easily tip over, which can add some challenge when filling with a purifier pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cranedoc

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the required packing list for a GORUCK. It has taken lots of abuse being crammed in my ruck and I have mixed up all kinds of drinks in it and it cleans up nicely. No leaks after many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher  McCallus

customer_reviews.title: I got these thinking they'd be a good bit of function for the weight
customer_reviews.text: I got these thinking they'd be a good bit of function for the weight. Well, they do function, and they're light... however, they don't roll up as well as you'd imagine. If packed volume is a concern, the size and rigidity of the material around the top prevent this from rolling up or storing as well as you might hope. Overall, these are nice and I'll get my use out of them, despite not being great for my original intended purpose for these.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can fill it with water and freeze it . Compact enough to put in the console of my Jet Ski and it stays cold all day. Living in Arizona this is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: miselaineous

customer_reviews.title: Nalgene Cantene a Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: This collapsable Nalgene bottle is a must-have on any backpacking trip. I can think of no other more valuable and lightweight water-storage device to have and use than this one. I purchased the 48oz. one for a two-person backpacking trip where natural water sources were scarce. Along with a water purifier (Katadyn Hiker, that fit the bottle mouth perfectly), we gathered water for meal times, and stored water for the early morning breakfast. This bottle worked in conjunction with a couple of 20oz. water bottles for the actual day hiking. The bottle weighs in at a scant 2.3 oz empty, and takes up almost no room in the backpack. This is a must-have on all my future backpacking trips...five stars!
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Moen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking - light and tough with large capacity
customer_reviews.text: This canteen is very useful for backpacking. It is light-weight and collapsible, but when I get into camp, I fill it with water and purify it. It's useful to have 48 ounces of purified water in camp. It would also be useful for carrying drinking water through places where there is no running water. It's very tough material.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: worked well with my intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cantene to use in winter backpacking when there is extreme weather. I will use it to pee in the boot well (vestibule space dug out).
customer_reviews.author: Ping Ping

customer_reviews.title: Never buying these baggy bottles again
customer_reviews.text: It started leaking after a few months. Useless. I've never had a baggy bottle that lasted, so too bad. I like the idea. But the execution is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a few months before leaking
customer_reviews.text: Quality is not up to par with other Nalgene products. Mine started leaking after a few months at the interface between the stiff plastic at the lid and the flexible plastic of the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this Nalgene bottle  :(
customer_reviews.text: I like the canteen a lot but it falls over if left standing on its own. The product description says the gusseted bottom allows it to stand upright--not so. It doesn't stand up. Also, I've been using it for a couple of months now (several days a week) and it now has developed pockets of air in the walls of the bottle which have collected water. Now the water always smells moldy. So I essentially have a baggie full of smelly water that can't stand on its own. Functional in a survival situation? Absolutely. Pleasant and usable on a daily basis? Not at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Medulan

customer_reviews.title: relatively durable
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these previously which survived 20-30 backpack trips over 10 years until it finally started to leak. REI no longer stocks them. The widemouth is my preference for attaching my MSR gravity filter. Or sometimes I use it to store my dog's water, as I can easily pour the leftover water from his bowl into this cantene. When it's no longer needed, it collapses to take up almost no space in the backpack (because why carry a huge empty cantene?).
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Performed above expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go backpacking with. I treat my regular drinking water and carry it in my Camelbak reservoir. But I needed a decent sized reservoir to carry enough water to cook with and to also wash up and clean my clothes at the camp site. This works perfect for me. It fills up very easily when dipping it in a stream or river. Also the best feature is that you can fold it up very small when it is not being used for water, which makes it ideal for backpacking. I am very happy with it, I plan on purchasing another one when mine wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Risley

customer_reviews.title: Back-Up Bottles
customer_reviews.text: I like these for several reasons. 1. Fill them up when leaving for a longer journey. As you drink, they take up less space and weight until they are refilled. 2. Very durable. I couldn't rip one with my hands when I tried. The part right below where the cap connects to the bottle is reinforced and stiff. 3. Standard nalgene cap allows it to be used with many of the nalgene cap-type accessories and certain water filters I like which can screw right onto it without any adapters. This is mainly why I chose these over platypus bags.
customer_reviews.author: Solaire of Astora

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Compact when not in use, no leakage in backpack when full
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Love this but don't park it next to your stove.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and have used them backpacking for the last couple of years. Reasonably light, big mouth, easy to fill. Just a "duh" warning. Don't let is set to close to the stove. That heat coming from the side of the pot will melt this. That is why this is my third.
customer_reviews.author: William Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Be carefull with it
customer_reviews.text: I took two of these bottles with me on a section hike of the Colorado Trail. I set one of them down kinda hard I DIDNT DROP IT. All of the sudden its leaking from the bottom not alot just enough to where a full bottle will be empty in 4 hours time. Do not carry these if your life is going to depend of them holding water. I like the shape, the wide mouth design everything about it except for the fast that one of them is leaking now. I have a platypus 3l bladder and it has gone through much more abuse and does not leak at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon011

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and can serve a variety of purposes (well ...
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and can serve a variety of purposes (well, pick one purpose and stick with it!)...those looking at this product probably know what I mean...
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Big enough, seals well, clean of chemicals and easy to clean, folds small as needed and lightweight. Since it has no good handle, I wonder if I can get a simple, inexpensive pouch to carry it and to keep it insulated and protected when I choose. I thought of making one but my daughter ridiculed me on that idea other than to use in the woods. Also it would be nice if it had a removable inner adapter to drink easier since the opening is large.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: On my bike tours I use this for a pee ...
customer_reviews.text: On my bike tours I use this for a pee bottle. In the morning I wash it out and it repacks and is ready for the next nights use. It beats searching dumpsters for a Gatorade bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Akridge

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This is great for backpacking on the Appalachian Trail. I also purchase some inserts at REI to keep the water from splashing when drinking and they were a plus. It is durable and uses less space as you drink from it.
customer_reviews.author: Circle C Rancher

customer_reviews.title: keep in your edc bag
customer_reviews.text: throw a lifestraw in one of these and youre good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, functional, handy
customer_reviews.text: I think the subject just about says it all. I found this to be very handy, light-weight (when empty; of course), and functional on my recent backpacking trips. It attached easily to my water filter whenever I needed to refill it and also fit nicely in my pack's side compression straps. It is easy to drink or pour from and it packs nicely when empty. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Toddias

customer_reviews.title: Nalgene takes a beating
customer_reviews.text: Nearly indestructible and esily collapsible to fit in your bag. Better than having the plastic bottle tapping around on your carbiner(s) or other gear. Wrap it in g-tape and it becomes a 2 in 1 tool as well plus it gives the canteen more strength for taking more abuse. Mine gets thrown around and still no leeks after more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: hdgriller

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile if you're backpacking the wilds with a filter, ...
customer_reviews.text: Worthwhile if you're backpacking the wilds with a filter, provided the plastic stays viable. Ordered two, one did not work for more than two days. Seal at bottom split and leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Cantene So Far
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this canteen to use as a pee bottle because it rolls up and has a wide opening, so it would be hard to miss. I never got around to using it for that purpose though, so I just used it as a water bottle and it turned out to be really good so far. I used it on a few day hikes in the summer in the everglades, and it didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy material
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy material, so you don't have to worry about your hot water bottle flooding your sleeping bag on a cold night. Threads right onto my MSR Miniworks filter for easy filtering. Typical bombproof quality that you'd expect from Nalgene.
customer_reviews.author: C. Flesher

customer_reviews.title: Love this container!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this water container. I bring it to work every day because I have a Brita filter at home and prefer to drink that water rather than tap water. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: stash it in a small space, or carry 3 pints
customer_reviews.text: Made of heavy, flexible plastic. When not in use, these fold or roll up to stow away in a small space. Stand vertical, or lay flat, when in use. Lid seals well.
customer_reviews.author: Makart

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: develops cracks at any fold - use puddle of gorilla glue to mend.
customer_reviews.author: orchardhaven

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: very durable while still being light. Use regularly to squeeze in a little extra H2O inside the backpack..... just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Roll-up when not needed. Materials seem to be strong enough to avoid punctures (within reason). Holds enough water for a nice day-hike (with fill-ups). Suggest having a couple for longer trips. *I also had a Nalgene wide-mouth bottle.
customer_reviews.author: jtwork

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This wide mouth canteen is great. It rolls up easy into packs when not in use and can hold enough water to keep hydrated. A well thought out plan to have the wide mouth, as it allows for pouring into or out of the canteen and allows for ice cubes when desired.
customer_reviews.author: Nezumi

customer_reviews.title: My nalgene canteen arrived on time and was exactly as ...
customer_reviews.text: My nalgene canteen arrived on time and was exactly as advertised. I look forward to using it in the bush as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great as pee bottle also :-)
customer_reviews.text: I used it as a pee bottle in a very cold weather. I took it to my climb to Kilimanjaro and I always have to get up at night to go bathroom. I wanted something light weight and space saver that I can easily carry. This worked out great. I did not have to run out of the tent at night in extremely cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: and it did great; No leakage
customer_reviews.text: Used it to keep lunch box cold; Filled half way with water and froze, and it did great; No leakage. It did sweat but I expected that so I placed inside another lrg ziplock but my food stayed cold all day.
customer_reviews.author: DesignRhouse

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews warn of leaks. I bought four of them and had no problems, even on the very tough Nankoweap Trail on the North Rim of the Grand Canyon. I carry them in an outside pocket of my backpack so if there is a leak, no big deal. Best of all, they are very light and play an important role in reducing weight.
customer_reviews.author: JMcDonald

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for traveling
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product I doubted about the quality and thought it might punctured easily. However during my vacations thr cantene was very useful and resisted all the voyage of two weeks. You must keep it away from sharp things.
customer_reviews.author: Intraticu

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of plastic near the cap. Compared to a rigid bottle this is a big space saver, no doubt, but I see room for improvement. I would like to see the cap portion and the piece just below at the top of the bottle shrunk down in the future.
customer_reviews.author: GlennTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Love these canteens!
customer_reviews.text: These collapsible canteens worked wonderfully for our backpacking trip! Needed something to transport a couple bottles of wine, and they worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good gear
customer_reviews.text: They must be handled with care and are a bit overpriced for what they are, but they're about the only wide-mouthed collapsible bottle on the market. Very good for the ultralight kit - especially when you need to get water from melted snow in the winter, or when you need to prefilter water from a "dirty" source.
customer_reviews.author: OGGWild

customer_reviews.title: ... was not a result of a puncture but just bad quality of the seam maunfacture
customer_reviews.text: bag leaked after a week of use at the seam so the leak was not a result of a puncture but just bad quality of the seam maunfacture.
customer_reviews.author: gunther

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: We keep one in our emergency "go" bags. The wide mouth makes it easy to use with a water purifier.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised; only reason for 4-stars is that after having used this I would rather have just purchased a rigid bottle because this is more difficult to drink from. So if you really need a collapsible bottle for something, this may be for you.
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: everyone should have at least one
customer_reviews.text: excellent as you can never have enough water period. i keep one in my bob and another with my kelty bp. i use it as redundant water on mid to long hikes as well as filtering direct from my kat hiker into the WMC when i'm not carrying my camelback
customer_reviews.author: dtals auto studio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Folds small so great for traveling/car camping. Good quality. Wide mouth for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bimka

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: We modify the caps on these to accept a Sawyer Mini Water filter. Love these soft bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Elam

customer_reviews.title: Best Pee Bottle Ever
customer_reviews.text: When you don't want to leave your tent or sleeping bag for a midnight pee, this is the ticket. The wide mouth is a lot easier in low light. In the morning just empty it, roll it up and stow it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This product is great for when you have to travel before you start ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for when you have to travel before you start your hydration requiring adventure. It collapses into a great size for packing but the plastic is still sturdy enough to last through some rough use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stritter

customer_reviews.title: ... backpacking camp canteen- the wide mouth lid makes it easy to clean- we always take one with to save ...
customer_reviews.text: End of the day backpacking camp canteen- the wide mouth lid makes it easy to clean- we always take one with to save weight while on the trail but to allow for a nice amount of water at camp.
customer_reviews.author: fedupwithcrap

customer_reviews.title: Us this with a Sawyer Squeeze Water Filter; best combination for ultralight backpacking water system!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ultralight backpacker so I use the Sawyer Squeeze water filter which works great, however, the opening on the bags are small and filling them is a pain; I bought this to adapt it for use with the Sawyer filter. Youtube has some videos on how to do this and you can also buy a cover that fits this cantene that has another threaded end you can screw your Sawyer unto. If you backpack and want a solution for filtering and carrying water, this is the nearly perfect solution!!
customer_reviews.author: Gideon

customer_reviews.title: great lightweight backup
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The standard Nalgene top fix my water filter. It's lightweight and collapsible. Nice for extra water. I wouldn't use it as my primary causes more likely to repartee or get a whole.
customer_reviews.author: WIStoney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water bottle.
customer_reviews.text: No problems with this as far as I'm concerned. Love that it gets smaller with less water that's in it. It will clear up some room for the end of the trip when you just don't feel like making your sleeping bag that much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great option for backpacking trips
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for camping or backpacking trips where space is limited and you need to pack light. It works great and does exactly what I'd expected.
customer_reviews.author: E.H.

customer_reviews.title: These are neat to use
customer_reviews.text: They save space there easy to uses I'm not confident on there durability cause I've bought one that lasted months but it ripped because of my fault but there convenient just be careful don't fill them completely
customer_reviews.author: JustinWR0311

customer_reviews.title: Packability
customer_reviews.text: Great for packing. Durability is great. Survives the dishwasher as well. Good bang for your buck, perfect for hiking. I've shopped around a bit and haven't found anything cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: REBUILT CUB

customer_reviews.title: Great Pee Bottle on Aconcagua....
customer_reviews.text: I realize that this was probably intended for a different purpose, but because it's compact...it was great to use as a pee bottle when it was too cold or windy to go outside at night.
customer_reviews.author: Bissell J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it like I love all of my nalgenes. But this is super handy for longer thru hikes. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent container
customer_reviews.text: Excellent container. Did not leak. I used it on a cruise to hold ice tea in the cabin''s refrigerator. There was not any plastic or chemical taste
customer_reviews.author: Pam Elkton MD

customer_reviews.title: I love this bottle so much
customer_reviews.text: I love this bottle so much - The only thing I don't like is that b/c I love it so much, I take it with me and accidentally leave it places and then my friends love it so much they keep it. Also - BPA free. enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Gee

customer_reviews.title: Never be thirsty again
customer_reviews.text: This wide mouth canteen is awesome. My husband and I went down to Florida the first week of July where the temperature got to be close to 100. I would fill these puppies the night before going somewhere, toss them in the freezer and use them the next day. They stayed frozen through out the day while keeping us hydrated. Easy to clean; just wash, let dry and flatten them to store in a closet. Great investment for hikers, bikers and the like.
customer_reviews.author: bluefish

customer_reviews.title: Light weight rolls up small
customer_reviews.text: Just like the title says, I got this for my day pack and to save weight and space. Seems very durable but time will tell, serves my needs very well. I would recommend to anyone needing a compact solution to there water storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Raptor4

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. Its a collapsible cantene. The seal on the top holds well, and it didn't leak. 5 stars for doing exactly what it was supposed to. Also, it is made of fairly sturdy material. It sat inside my 70L pack during a multi day hike on the AT with no ill effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan V

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, must have liquid carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that is concerned with bag storage space, whether it be a backpacker, bike rider, etc., should consider buying one or two of these canteens. These are great for outdoor situations where space is limited and extra water may be needed. They also can be loaded with mixed adult beverages, thrown in a cooler, and brought to the beach. ...OR they could be used as a leak-proof urinal. I feel best carrying these near a more traditional water bottle just in case there is leaking, but I have not had any leaks yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maryland

customer_reviews.title: developed a crack in the seam
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked fine for about... a month.. then developed a crack/hole in the corner on the bottom, so become useless. but the idea is good.
customer_reviews.author: seeker407

customer_reviews.title: Just as Described
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a hiking trip to the bottom of the Grand Canyon. Great product and it's nice to have bottles that take up very little room in your pack when they're empty instead of bulky empty water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: kgreenred

customer_reviews.title: ... awkward for every day carry purposes but I do like it for keeping water available in my hotel room
customer_reviews.text: It's too big and awkward for every day carry purposes but I do like it for keeping water available in my hotel room, etc. No complaints about the construction--I think Nalgene makes good products across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K. Nimm

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple, great product. We use it on long hikes when our Camelbaks aren't enough. Its collapsible nature is perfect for hiking. The wide mouth is a little hard to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Peck

customer_reviews.title: I purchased two of these canteens for trips into the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these canteens for trips into the backcountry and they exceeded all expectation. A big thank you go out to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leak easy to open/close
customer_reviews.text: Good easy closure...love it for hiking and also used it to store water in a hotel fridge...no leak!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Vardakis

customer_reviews.title: Space Saving Nalgenes
customer_reviews.text: Traveled around the world with these and loved them. You can roll them up when not in use and they hold a lot of water. They require two hands to drink from because (obviously) they aren't rigid and will bend/splash without a little two-handed guidance.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: Developed leak after 5 days
customer_reviews.text: Developed a leak after 5 days of use. I've used these before and was happy but this one broke very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric O.

customer_reviews.title: works nice at catching water from any water source
customer_reviews.text: def not a water bottle to carry. its a little big. works nice at catching water from any water source. easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: BelieveMyreview

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great way to pack ice in cooler, and then use the water to drink. Reusable and dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: janet kindle

customer_reviews.title: Useful item
customer_reviews.text: Main use will be as an ice container to use to cool items in a small cooler. I've used it once this way, and it works great--much better than a zipper bag I used previously.
customer_reviews.author: Liz K

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottle
customer_reviews.text: Rolls up small but still has the standard Nalgene lid. I like this bottle.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The best thing is that you can gather water from a stream and use your lifestraw to drink from the container--I did this and everything worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: Terryfic

customer_reviews.title: Packable Nalgene goodness
customer_reviews.text: Collapsible Nalgene goodness. The lid seals just as well as on the hard bottles, but the compressibility of the bottle when empty makes it perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: RGModsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price/quality
customer_reviews.text: Does the job . Nalgene , the trusted name. Using on backpacking trip to desert. Make certain to not place on cactus spikes or sharp rocks as this will weaken/puncture.
customer_reviews.author: scout

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use with Sawyer Personal Water Bottle . . . to hold more water. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Step Lively

customer_reviews.title: Wide opening and reliable cap equals better nights while cold weather camping
customer_reviews.text: My go to piss bottle in my tent. Wide opening and reliable cap equals better nights while cold weather camping.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty much a water bottle that is flexible. I haven't had any negative experiences so far with the cantene that I received, sturdy build, and no defects thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Kevie

customer_reviews.title: Good so far..
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 48oz canteen. It was great to have the extra water on the couple hikes I took it on so far (it supplements my 32oz hard Nalgene). Fits neatly in my pack full and empty. Looks and feels like it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Strong, easy to clean, collapsible, what's not to like
customer_reviews.text: Love these for carrying extra water backpacking. Fold up to nothing when empty. Nice and strong. Wide mouth makes cleaning easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: the product is easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for years I love it
customer_reviews.author: Janice Sumpter

customer_reviews.title: great cantene
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, stands up straight even with very little volume inside of it. Love the fact that I can roll it up when it's not filled for very compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easier to pack for climbing than a solid bottle and holds more.
customer_reviews.author: CALVIN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my go to canteen for day hikes in the woods. never leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Eaglesnation

customer_reviews.title: THUNDER JAR!
customer_reviews.text: Collapsible and easy to pack. This is your ultimate THUNDER JAR!
customer_reviews.author: Technaut

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Durable
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my backpacking trip through the cactus infested desert of Big Bend National Park. It stood up to me throwing it around(on gravel), laying on it while it was in my pack and just being very rough with it throughout the grueling 4 day hike.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

product_meta.title: Wide Mouth Cantene
product_meta.description: This Mouth Wide Canteen is made of multilayered material that offers stiffness and strength for stand-up capability, yet is soft and flexible to be folded or rolled. The wide mouth opening accepts ice cubes and provides easy access for cleaning. Also accommodates all major water filters. Guaranteed leakproof system with loop-top cap. Gusseted bottom stands upright.
feature_bullets: The multilayered material offers stiffness and strength for stand-up capability, yet is soft and flexible to be folded or rolled.
Wide mouth opening accepts ice cubes and provides easy access for cleaning.
Also accommodates all major water filters.
Guaranteed leakproof system with loop-top cap. Gusseted bottom stands upright.
Wide-Mouth Cantene made of multilayered material for stiffness, strength, and stand-up capability, yet is soft and flexible to be folded or rolled when empty
Wide opening accepts ice cubes and provides easy access for cleaning, and also accommodates all major water filters
Guaranteed leakproof system and loop-top cap offer reliability and versatility, and gusseted bottom stands upright
Dishwasher safe on the top rack, and withstands temperatures from -20 to 220 degrees Fahrenheit
Guaranteed for the life of the product; made in the USA
